With your internal links, you’ve shown G: With your internal links, you’ve shown Google which articles are most important on your website! Make sure to check regularly whether your cornerstone approach is still up to date!
Go to a related article, find a relevant: Go to a related article and find a relevant sentence which is related to your cornerstone article. Insert a text link to your cornerstone in that sentence. Repeat with another related article until your cornerstones have the most internal links pointing towards them.
If you have limited internal links point: If you have limited internal links pointing towards your cornerstones, add internal links from other posts to your cornerstones. But, make sure that there’s a logical relationship between the article from which you're linking and your cornerstone. Below, we'll always show you the three cornerstone articles which receive the least links on your site and offer suggestions of relevant pages from which you could link.
